name: Habitat Services
description: Measures the services provided by marine and coastal habitats

name: Carbon Storage
description: Captures the carbon stored in natural coastal ecosystems that absorb and sequester carbon in large amounts.

name: Coastal Protection
description: Measures the amount of protection coral habitats and native vegetation provide by measuring the current area they cover relative to the area they covered in the recent past.

name: Conservation Economy
description: Measures the amount of money generated for the ecological protection and restoration of Tetiaroa

name: Sense of Place
description: Aims to capture the level of protection for aspects of Tetiaroa that contribute to a person's sense of cultural identity.

name: Iconic Species
description: This subgoal captures the species that are important to Tetiaroa  because they are relevant to local cultural identity.

name: Lasting Special Places
description: This subgoal captures the level of management of Tetiaroa's marine and coastal areas to best preserve aesthetic

name: Biodiversity
description: Captures the conservation status of marine species.

name: Habitats
description: This subgoal measures the condition of habitats that are important for supporting a wide array of species diversity.

name: Species
description: This subgoal aims to estimate how successfully the richness and variety of marine life is being maintained.

name: Tourism & Recreation
description: Captures the value people have for experiencing and taking pleasure in Tetiaroa

name: Clean Waters
description: Captures the degree to which Tetiaroa's waters are polluted.

name: Resource Access Opportunity
description: Captures the access people have to coastal resources
weight: whether or not they actually take fish or harvest from coastal waters."
